items.name: Campo de Carabobo
items.address: Valencia Highway - Campo de Carabobo, Libertador Municipality.
items.description: A historic site where the Battle of Carabobo was fought in 1821, a decisive event in Venezuela's independence. It features a triumphal arch, statues, and a museum commemorating the battle.

items.name: Catedral de Valencia
items.address: Calle Colombia, between Av. Urdaneta and Av. Soublette, Valencia.
items.description: A stunning cathedral located in the heart of Valencia. Known for its colonial-style architecture, it is one of the most important religious landmarks in the city.

items.name: Parque recreacional sur
items.description: One of the largest recreational parks in Valencia. It offers walking trails, picnic areas, sports zones, and spaces for family-friendly events.

items.name: Acuario de Valencia
items.address: Sector Los Colorados, Av. Fernando Figueredo
items.description: A popular aquarium showcasing marine life from the Caribbean Sea. It is an educational and family-friendly destination that highlights local biodiversity.

items.name: Monumento a la caña
items.description: A scenic seaside promenade with views of the Caribbean Sea. Perfect for enjoying the sea breeze, dining at restaurants, and watching spectacular sunsets.

items.name: Plaza Bolívar
items.address: Centro de Valencia, near the Palacio Municipal.
items.description: A central plaza in Valencia dedicated to Simón Bolívar. Surrounded by historic buildings, it is a hub for cultural and social activities.

items.name: Sambil
items.description: A large shopping mall and entertainment complex in Naguanagua. It features stores, restaurants, cinemas, and recreational areas for all ages.
